intro: Actinostemon cantagallensis, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its strap-like, evergreen leaves that form dense clumps. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in summer, which are clustered in loose panicles. It is often found in coastal and forest margins, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and historical significance, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
